comments:
Running against JIRA 3.6-#153, HTTP (i.e., not HTTPS)

If I add an existing JIRA task and it's closed then I can see the issue in Mylar. If I add an open existing task then I get the following stack trace:

java.lang.NullPointerException

For existing, open tasks the npe is followed by an 'Unhandled event loop exception' - Eclipse says a stack trace isn't available.

If I try to run an existing JIRA query, I get the following (same line causing the problem):

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.JiraRepositoryConnector.updateTaskDetails(JiraRepositoryConnector.java:259)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.JiraRepositoryConnector.performQuery(JiraRepositoryConnector.java:178)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.tasks.ui.SynchronizeQueryJob.run(SynchronizeQueryJob.java:84)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

Mik will want to look at this one but he is away at the moment. He'll probably get to this early next week.  In the mean time, does your Jira server have custom priority levels? It looks like this could result if the server returns a priority level outside of 1 - 5.

It looks like a custom priority thing to me too.  Perhaps you need an 'other' priority?  It might be possible to guess a mylar priority value for custom priorities based on their position in the list of available priorities (assuming they come back ordered).

Sorry, submitted to soon.  I  resolved this by making the code robust to unknown priority levels and setting them as default.  If an unrecognized priority is processed it will be printed to the log.  A dev build with this update should be available on Monday.  If you could try that out and let us know the priorities that you're seeing logged that would be helpful.  Or just let us know what the JIRA web UI lists as the priorities and we can consider handling customized priority levels more gracefully.
